Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I loved the compact size and great quality pictures with my SD1200. Too bad I dropped it out of my car. This next generation is better with more pixels and telephoto. Wish it had a viewfinder, but most cameras this size and price don't have one.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: For the quick shots because it's so small and handy, it was a present for my wife and she loves it. Her photos are clean and sharp. She also used camera video to shoot humming birds feeding from our garden deckand placed the video on her FB page. Have not heard any negatives about her camera to date. She has been using her camera for 3 weeks now.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I use this from everyday shots of my kids to trips to the zoo and capture great shots of animals in their element. Recently just took some awesome skyline pics of Chicago from Lake Michigan. One slight problem is that when pulling camera from case the lens sometimes gets stuck if I accidently push the on button while gripping the camera. This results in a lens error but doesn't seem to damage camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good things do come in small packages.
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Small / Compact; Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay
Although, the auto focus feature is a nice adddition, it takes a little getting used to. The picture in the LCD display at first is very pixally however, after the shot is comprised the image turns out beautifully. Great little camera and at a great little price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I bought several of these for our staff to take property photos. We don't need a monster slr. We just need small cameras that take good pictures and have plenty of battery life. The PowerShot SD1300 IS fits the bill.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use
Cons: No Viewfinder; Lag / Shutter Delay
It's a little slow in taking pictures. That's my only complaint.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: This is our second PowerShot. The first broke after several years of use. Since we liked the old one, we figured the newer model could only be better. Wrong! Soon after purchase, the camera started to have periods where the pictures would be completely washed out. Other times we had issues with the automatic white balance. Other times pictures would come out very fuzzy as if the autofocus is not working. Also, when you are indoors/dimly lit areas, it took the camera an eternity to focus and take the picture. We thought that we just happened to get a lemon. Unfortunately, my mother-in-law who purchased the same camera is experiencing similar problems.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I've been pleased with this camera. The battery life is really long which is a plus for someone on the go! The picture quality is sharp. I can also say that there isn't as much lag time between taking continuous pictures as there has been with older models of the same camera. Canon is always my go-to brand, and I haven't been disappointed with this one. My highest quality pics are taken outdoors, but the flash is pretty powerful for a compact camera. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent choice as the first camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Easy To Use; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Good Image Quality; Nice Body Color; Large Clear LCD
I bought this camera for my husband, who is new to photography. This is a good first camera to introduce him to photography, because of ease of use and image stabilization. Compact size and silver color looks cool and makes it easy to carry wherever you go. This camera gives the maximum bang for the buck.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact; Nice Body Color
Cons: Have not found one yet
I have not read the directions yet to know how to fully utilize all the features. I just started pointing and clicking and started figuring some things out along the way. I love it. My photos are very nice and I am impressed with the camera and would definitely recommend to friends and family. I has all the features I want and need. I especially love the rechargeable battery and charger and the timer.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Small / Compact; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Great Zoom
camera takes excellent color pics. Always takes sharp pics. does not have a ton of feature options to deal with, just point and shoot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Loved my canons until this one
Item.Review:
Pros: love the ease of use is great. switching from modes
Cons: turns on too easy
I have had a couple different Canons. I got the sc1300 is in July 2010 and now its Feb 2011 and i have had to replace it 2 times because of a "Lens error" which is a manufacters defect. Which i think happenes because it can be turned on too easy in your pocket and when the lens doesnt open it breaks. I will not be replacing it with the same model again..

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: fast to take pictures
Cons: sometimes pictures not so great you have to aim for your good shots
after hearing rave reviews and not liking a sony cybershot i went with this camera and although each had their strong points this camera had less weak points if that makes sense. good battery life, decent pics. the automode always trys to focus on the wrong thing tho

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: It is easy to use.
Cons: Rechargable battery as opposed to direct charge.
Photographers destined to become great in the future and are building their skills now, or those who have no patience for all of those confusing settings and buttons will love this camera. The video option recorded some priceless tender Christmas moments, and the zoom, some beautiful 1st birthday, cake in the face, frameable portraits. Amazing quality for a simple to use camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for a really good price. Easy to use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple operation, sharp pictures
Cons: So far nothing, Love it
I bought this for a gift to my dad who is 80. He loves it and finds it easy to use. It takes great pictures, and the battery holds a charge a long time. So far it is all good!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, ease of use
Cons: .jpgs are very large.
It's easy to use! That was my basic objective, along with being compact, and it meets both those criteria.
I'm still trying to figure out how to use some of the features. Also trying to figure out why the .jpgs are so big.
I bought this for travel, have another digital when I want to take trickier shots. Love that this fits easily into my purse.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for my daughter who is at college
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes great pictures
My daughter seems to always lose her camera. I was determined to by a good quality camera at reasonable cost. This camera is perfect for her. The small size is perfect to fit in her purse. It is very easy to use....she started using it the first day without reading directions. I would highly recommend this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good camera for a point & shoot!
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple and good pics
Cons: would prefer AA or AAA batteries for ease of replacement in a pinch.
Was looking for small and simple. This camera filled the bill! Very happy with my purchase.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, picture quality
Cons: nothing
Especially for the price, I am very pleased. Some internal memory would have been nice, but with memory being so cheap now, the trade-off in order to get the great pricing I think is a great deal.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Fast/accurate auto-focus
Cons: No Viewfinder
We have other Canon Cameras and needed one to use for job pictures. This meets our needs and takes really clear pictures. Great small camera for a point and shot user.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I needed a digital camera to move into the 21st century, but didn't want to spend too much. This is an easy-to-use camera for a novice like me. It's small, yet the pictures look clear and sharp. [...] the price was comparable to other sources.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I love the clear quality and color of the pictures. The camera is easy to use and my photos require little to no touching-up once they are uploaded onto my computer. The only thing I would say is that whoever is taking the picture needs to make sure the camera focuses before taking the shot or else the picture can come out blurry. Otherwise, a great little camera!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
It's great for family events and vacations. My vacation pictures are always great looking and family members have told me they like the pictures that it takes. It's very good on low light.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good starter, but not for larger hands
Item.Review:
Pros: Small and compact; Large viewscreen; Excellent Quality Picture; Easy to use
Cons: Small Buttons
I bought this camera for my dad -- a novice who has larger fingers and is inexperienced with digital cameras in general. The menu system and functionality was user-friendly, but the shutter and zoom buttons were a little small for him to use well.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use with lots of features
Cons: Image colors were bad
I quickly and easily went through the camera settings and was able to set it up to my liking without reading through the manual. Lots of great settings even if you want to "dial in" the right balance for each shot, but also has lots of "auto" features which most will find handy.
I took several images with this camera when we first bought it and had terrible results with the image colors while using the flash. The subject of the image would look fine, but the entire background looked like it was painted with a yellow/orange tint.
I could turn the flash setting to "off" and get better results, but then it seemed like the image stabilization suffered (I don't think I developed a twitch). This camer ... a was for my wife who will do nothing but use the "Auto" settings (including flash) so I had to return it and try another. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Haven't found anything yet
After buying a panasonic and hating it, I returned it and bought this instead. I am SO GLAD I did. This camera's picture quality is just beautiful! I am so happy with this camera..the design and features are great and easy to use as well. Would definitely recommend this camera!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: The camera is overall good, especially for the price! The zoom is very good as well as the quality picture. NOTE: This does NOT come with a memory card. This may explain why the price is low. . . .

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I have rheumatoid arthrits. I found the camera easy to hold and use. opening the battery/photo card space and removing/placing them was no problem. Instructions were also easy to follow. Pictures are true to the original with good clarity. colors were also true. I'm enjoying my new camera. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact; Easy To Use
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay
Great camera. Just point and shoot. Great deal! Came with 4GB SD Memory, Camera case, lense cleaner.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Just What I Was Looking For
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Nice Body Color; Small / Compact; Easy To Use
Cons: LCD can be jittery in sun
I wanted a camera that took quality family photos, but wasn't going to break the bank. This camera fit the bill nicely. Pictures are very clear whether using the Auto or Manual modes. The videos are great and it is so easy to use. I am very happy with this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: Very practical camera, easy to use, great price for what you get. The only disappointment was the difference between the colors on the pc screen and the camera, colors became less vibrant, and not so good in low light. Other that that, I would definitely recommend it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality.
Cons: Would prefer camera had metal body instead of plastic.
I love this camera. I read many reviews after my sony of 7 yrs shot craps before making this purchase. I above all wanted a camera which took great pics at an economical price. I've had it a little over a month and am very pleased with the pic quality. I struggle sometime with downloading the pics but I know it will get easier with repeated use. I am very much a novice at photography but enjoy the candid shots of friends, family , pets, etc. So far I am exremely satisfied with my Canon. I even recommended it to my son who is in Okinawa. Very much worth the money.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Short Lag Time; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact; Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Great Zoom
Cons: Limited Zoom
I bought this camera to replace my old Canon that had a fried processing unit. I LOVE this camera!! The "Auto" function is awesome, and the zoom is mostly what I prefer it to be. Can't complain too much about the macro setting as I'd need a different camera and lenses to do the zooming I tend to do (see pictures). I've found no faults with it... just love it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use just point and click-it focused for me
Cons: nothing
I bought camera right before I went to Alaska. I used AUTO setting as I was afraidI wouldn't remember correct setting as a moose ran by. The pics were great . I received many compliments from more experienced photographers on my pics

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Best, most intuitive compact camera we have owned
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use. Screen visible in sunlight
Cons: It is the best compact I have owned
Through loss, theft and whatever we have owned several compact cameras. The last one, a nikon cool pix. They have all been marginal. hard to see screens in the sunlight, to complicaed to remember the controls.
The Canon SD 1300 IS has solved all of my complaints in a elegant, easy to use package. The screen brightness can be adjusted so the image is visable even in bright Italinan sun. All of the controls are very easy to figure out, without carrying the manual around. Pictures are great as to be expected.
I love this camera. Have not even liked the ones I have owned in the past.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, easy to use, design...
Cons: Nothing so far....
For $150 it is a great camera. The most, the picture quality. It is really easy to use, and it fits perfectly in my hand. Good battery life. I just love it.
My former Canon had a problem with the CCD (image sensor), and Canon sent to me a refurbished camera free (newer model), even when my warranty was expired for more than two years. Time later, the CCD of the second camera got broken again. Canon addressed the problem, and I hope by this time they will had corrected it definitely.
They treated me well, and both cameras took great pictures, so I wanted to trust them one more time. Hope everything will work well this time.
Best.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Great size; Short Lag Time; Good Image Stabilization; Great Zoom; Easy to use on auto mode; Nice Body Color; Sharp Pictures
Cons: No panorama stitch
I just received the camera a few days ago. Have used it for pics of grandchildren (inside the house) and some outside test shots. The low light pictures are really nice but make sure your finger does not cover the flash. I bought it for an upcoming trip to England. The manual shows the camera will do a lot more than I thought and I look forward to learning more. I will use the "auto" mode mostly. I bought the leather case too and rec it as well.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for real estate use
Item.Review:
Pros: Wide angle lens and long battery life
The wide angle lens is advantageous for real estate photos, and the quality is excellent. Battery life is outstanding!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I really love this camera! It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. I especially like the auto mode since I'm not into setting a camera manually just yet. It seems very sturdy and well built. I would recommend it for the price. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I use this as my personal quick shot camera for parties, events and such. The images are crisp, clean and contain wonderful color. The delay for focusing is minimal so you're able to take your quick photos. Easy to carry and durable enough to survive my purse. I haven't found anything I do not like about it yet! So glad I purchased it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: Great housing for starting underwater photography. If you already have the Canon SD 1300 camera this will get it safely underwater. Very simple to use, just drop in the camera, close the back and go. So far I have used it on 6 dives in the Turks & Caicos up to 90 ft. deep and not a drop of water inside. The internal flash works ok but to get true colors, I think the external flash is needed. I plan on making that my next purchase.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: Recently used it along the California coast, Hearst Castle, and 2 weeks later Lake Tahoe. The pictures and videos it takes are fantastic, and it's slim line feature, make it easy to carry around. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good picture quality and easy user interface
Cons: Slow response time
One point that has not been brought out in these reviews is the really slow response time to taking a picture (latency). This camera takes a photo 1 - 2 seconds after you press the shutter button, making it unusable for any action shots, and most normal point-and-shoot shots. Returned the day after I bought it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good replacement battery for Canon S90
Item.Review: Very good product. While the Canon battery has a one-month warranty, these have a lifetime warranty. Lasts as long as the original Canon battery that came with the camera

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I've had this camera for 3 weeks now. Iv'e taken great pictures and videos above and below the surface. This camera has so many wonderful features that I haven't even used yet.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Great Battery Life; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization; Good in Low Light; Short Lag Time
Cons: No view finder
This is my first digital camera so I don't have much to compare it with but I do not have any complaints so far. Love the brown color and everything else about it! It does not have a view finder, just a screen and I was wondering how bad that would be on a sunny day but it's been fine so far. I think it's a good deal for the money.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Best point n shoot camera I've owned!
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color; Short Lag Time; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Limited Zoom
I have owned several point and shoot cameras and this one is the best I have owned so far. This is so easy to use and takes great shots! The picture quality is great for the price and it is small enough to carry with you at all times. So far, so good! Very happy with my purchase.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: This is a very easy camera to use. It is my first digital camera and I am happy with it. The only disappointment I have with it is that it does not have the feature to pick out one color in a shot and have the rest of the picture come out in black and white. I am not sure what that feature is called, but I do know that the Powershot SD1100IS does have that option. This was one of the reasons I purchased this camera. The description did not have a good detail of the enhancements available. I assumed it would have the feature. Don't assume! I should have called customer service. Overall I am very happy with this camera. The battery lasts a long time. (A BIG plus!!!) ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Good Image Stabilization
Just started using it, so far like it for the use. I needed a small one which can go into my pocket when I really do not need to carry my bulky SLR around. Pretty impressed by the picture quality and ease of handling. Cannon brand..makes it feel better.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: PowerShot SD 1300 digital camera by Cano
Item.Review: We use this camera for family events such as birthdays, Christmas and other holidays. We also rely on this camera for recording our travels, both domestic and foreign. The camera is lightweight and very slim. It is so easy to carry in its case or in my pocket. There is really nothing about the camera that I do not like.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: We bought 3 of the cameras for our real estate appraisal office. We need cameras that take a beating since we use them all day every day. So far these SD1300's are hitting the spot. They're simple to use and have just the right amount of features. You have the auto mode which is great for everyday use and then the program mode with just the right amount of shooting modes. I can't stand the cameras with 40 different shooting modes. I don't think there is a reason to have 4 underwater modes and 3 different portrait modes... that's overkill. The only complaint I really have is the lack of a view finder, which was scrapped for the larger LCD screen. I know it's not as popular as it used to be, but the screen is not bright enough to out shine direct sunlight, so a viewfinder would come in handy ... . Basically, if you're looking for something to get the job done and don't want to read a dostoevsky novel to understand how to use it, then this is the camera for you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again & again
Item.Review: I absolutely LOVE the Power Shot SD1300. I am a person who does not like change, BUT, I was talked into trying a digital camera and once using the Power Shot SD 1300 I never looked back. I hike with my dog up in the mountains of NYS and always have the camera at my ready..I was able to get a Red Tail Hawk awaiting it's prey up in a tree, etc. and other facinating and fantastic sights with Mother Nature. The clarity of the photos, the easiness of the use and the understanding of the camera makes it the absolute best for me. While in N.C. I dropped my Power Shot SD1300 and it broke. I immediately contacted my niece in Suffern, NY who through B&H ordered me a new Power Shot SD1300 ..[...]. I cannot praise this camera enough. It is GREAT!!!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I owned a Canon camera before and I needed to update. This one is nice and small and easy to use. Takes a much larger card that is so tiny you wonder how it can hold so much more. Amazing. Great pictures.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Short Lag Time; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality
Cons: Limited Zoom
Just what I was looking for in a compact camera when we cruise. When we get off the ship I needed something small that still takes great photos. I'm a Canon fan anyway as I have two other Canon cameras. This one fits in my pocket, or in my wife's purse. Indoor low light photos are very good. Turned out to be a perfect fit for what I wanted.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Solid Canon quality and great pictures
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Short Lag Time
While I'm no expert on camera performance or technical details, I can say that this is a good quality camera in this price range. I owned a Canon SD750 that was stolen. prior to this, and the SD1300 seems to be compare quite well with that gem. Navigating the features is very similar to the 750 but will not be too tricky for someone completely new to the layout. Good picture quality and a super-fast start up make it an ideal camera for the casual user like myself.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes great pictures.
Cons: Price was dropped by another store as clearence alot cheaper by 50%
Just got back from 7 day Cruise. Bought this camera for 99.99. Used this camera as the primary camera for all pictures. Used this in day, night , outside, inside and several different lighting conditions. You can't go wrong with this camera. It is quick and easy to use. Read the instructions and you will not have any problems.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, quality
This is the best camera I have ever purchased. It's actually my 3rd one. I had one for myself and one for my daughter. She lost hers and I replaced it for her. The price is great for the quality of photo!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: The only thing I do not like about it is the way it works with people moving. It always is blurry. Other than that, its a great camera. Takes nice pictures and videos!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: Bought this housing and the Canon SD1300 camera to take down to Cozumel. Great pictures and video from such a simple package. Scuba diving down to 100 feet and it worked great.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Cons: Horrible picture quality.
I was an instant fan after I got my first Canon camera. This is the 2nd Canon I have purchased and was immediately disappointed. My 890IS was infinitely better at taking pictures and video and gave much higher quality. I have not taken a single image with my 1300IS that I have been happy with. Everything comes out really blurry and/or LOTS of noise. The 1300IS video so far has been VERY unreliable.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and takes great pictures
Cons: Have no complaints yet
This is a great camera. That is easy to use as soon as you get it out of the box. Leaving the setting as is takes great, clear pictures. Its very easy to use and the quality is great.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.ReviewTitle: Fair entry level unit, but you grow beyond it fast
Item.Review: A good entry level camera for casual users, or a "disposable" backup cam. Very good outdoor shots, but indoor shots can be less than great. The flash can be overly strong for many shots. The processing/saving lag is surprisingly long.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use
Cons: Loved everything about it
It's compact, easy to use, pictures are fabulous! First camera that I have ever bought that came with it's own battery charger. It is very fast.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Lighting, color, sharpness
Cons: Nothing that I can think of
We love this camera. I bought this camera in a hurry and at the last minute as I had left my digital SLR at home for an event. The clarity and lighting of the photos are brilliant - I now use it in place of my SLR for family pics and events.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and the directions are easy to understand
Cons: You need to purchase a SD card.
I bought this as a christmas gift for my sister. She is technically challenged and just now learning to use a computer. So now she has a digital camera. She loves it. Though she hasn't uploaded to facebook and shared her pics I know she will soon. She said the camera is easy to use and understand. For her that says a lot!!! And that says a lot for Canon as well.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: picture quality and price
I used Canon Cameras throughout the years and i was always very satisfied. I bought this camera on a black friday deal, after i broke my older Canon. I am very pleased so far. It takes great pictures and it is very easy to use for soemone who wants nice pictures but not something too sophisticated.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: Time between pictures & time to focus are slower than I would prefer. Sometimes I miss the picture I'm trying to get.
I had a camera that I loved and I miss things about my old one, but this camera is a good replacement. Easy to use, easy to learn to use, good pictures. I have found that it is more important to "half push" the photo button for longer on this camera than on my last one, as I end up with out of focus pictures more easily, but if I take the time to let the camera focus, the quality is great. I also think that the focus and recycle time takes longer with this camera than others that I have used.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Small / Compact; Nice Body Color; Good in Low Light; Good Image Quality
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay
Got this to keep in my purse and just have on hand while wandering around NYC on a daily basis. There are always good shots to be had in the city, and this is a great camera to just have in my purse that doesn't take up room or add extra weight. I've always loved Canon and this camera doesn't disappoint!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: It is a good camera. My favorite feature is that you can turn it to see the picture vertical. We are taking this to Hawaii so I may have a more thorough review after our trip in March.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features and picture quality
Cons: start up time a little slow
I had an older canon and I found for the price this was a great upgrade that won't hurt your pocket too much. Good size camera that packs a lot of punch. Well worth the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review: I haven't had a chance to use my new camera a ton yet, or really play around with the features, but so far so good. my boyfriend used it a bit and in some settings had problems with yellowiness/off colors and a little blurriness, but in normal conditions and outdoors it works great so far! and it's so tiny... after my last camera (also a canon, which I loved but it was stolen from me) I didn't think they could keep getting smaller but they have! doesn't feel cheap or fragile though which is nice. ...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great pics and easy to use
Cons: none so far
I was always been a canon fan and my SD700 finally gave up after 5 yrs. After researching and reading several reviews, i decided to get this camera. I had it for a month and i must say i love it. It takes great pictures, easy to use and got a good price deal during christmas sale.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Large Clear LCD; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
I use this camera when I am not into serious photography. I usually carry my SLR always but wanted something to go in my pocket to take some casual photos so I got this one. I have used it during the holiday season took some pictures. Quality is good and the flash is really powerful, if you are planning to take pictures inside a room.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH SD1300 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)

Pros: Nice variety of settings; Really good close ups
Cons: No color swap; No color enhancer
I really miss the color swap and color enhancer. please bring it back!
